    • Method Detail

      • playbackRecord

        public void playbackRecord()
        This method is responsible for playing past games.

      • finalSaveReplay

        public void finalSaveReplay()
        This method takes the game that ended and saves it locally.

      • saveTheReplay

        public void saveTheReplay()
        This method asks for the name of the game that finished. Inputting a name will allow the game to be saved.

      • gameOver

        public void gameOver()
        This method prompts the user if they'd like to save the replay.

      • resetChessboard

        public void resetChessboard()
        This method resets the entire chessboard and its pieces to their original positions.

      • copyChessboard

        public void copyChessboard()
        This method simply creates a backup copy of the chessboard to be used in other test cases, such as undoing a move and failing a move due to a check.

      • revertChessboard

        public void revertChessboard()
        This method reverts the main chessboard to a backup copy of the chessboard.

      • printChessboard

        public void printChessboard()
        This method is responsible for printing the chessboard, only to be called after each successful turn. Note: This method is not called if a player makes an illegal move.

      • nodenumToCommand

        public java.lang.String nodenumToCommand(int x,
                                         int y)
        Parameters:
        x - The x value of the designated node.
        y - The y value of the designated node.
        Returns:
        Returns the command to be used for when a move is to be made.

      • convertCommand

        public int convertCommand(java.lang.String command,
                          int mode)
        This method converts user input into indexes that Java arrays can easily read.
        Parameters:
        command - A position that is converted into integer indexes that can be easily read by Java arrays.
        mode - Two modes exist for this method. When mode = 1, the method converts x coordinates. When mode = 2, the method converts y coordinates.
        Returns:
        Returns an integer.

      • setDraw

        public void setDraw()

      • drawDecision

        public void drawDecision()

      • checkLegality

        public boolean checkLegality(int x1Node,
                             int y1Node,
                             int x2Node,
                             int y2Node)
        This method checks whether or not the two parameter user inputs constitutes a legal move.
        Parameters:
        x1Node - x-coordinate of the first point
        y1Node - y-coordinate of the first point
        x2Node - x-coordinate of the second point
        y2Node - y-coordinate of the second point
        Returns:
        Returns true or false, whether a move is considered legal or not.

      • checkKing

        public boolean checkKing(int xPos,
                         int yPos,
                         java.lang.String phase)
        This method is responsible for placing a check on the King. Called whenever a King moves or at the beginning of each turn.
        Parameters:
        xPos - x-coordinate of the point to be tested for a possible Check
        yPos - y-coordinate of the point to be tested for a possible Check
        phase - Either "White" or "Black", depending on which player's King is being checked
        Returns:
        Returns true or false, depending on whether or not a player's King is in Check.

      • isCheckmate

        public boolean isCheckmate(java.lang.String playerTurn)
        This method determines whether or not a player is in Checkmate. A player that is in Checkmate loses the game.
        Parameters:
        playerTurn - Either "White" or "Black", depending on who is checked for a possible Checkmate
        Returns:
        Returns true or false. If true is returned, the playerTurn loses.

      • isStalemate

        public boolean isStalemate(java.lang.String playerTurn)
        This method checks if a player is in Stalemate. A Stalemate is determined if a King is not in Check, but has no other legal moves available. Thus, the match ends in a draw.
        Parameters:
        playerTurn - Either "White" or "Black", depending on who is checked for a possible Stalemate
        Returns:
        Returns true or false. If true, end the game in a draw.

      • makeYourMove

        public void makeYourMove(java.lang.String arg1,
                         java.lang.String arg2)
        This method is called each turn, alternating between white and black.

      • playerLoop

        public void playerLoop()

      • chooseMove

        public void chooseMove(java.lang.String input)
